quotes.text: Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: The man who is always blowing his own horn is usually out of tune.
quotes.author: Josh Billings
quotes.attribution: Josh Billings' Encyclopedia of Wit and Wisdom 1874

quotes.text: A man who carries a cat by the tail learns something he can learn in no other way.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: Half the lies they tell about me aren't true.
quotes.author: Chauncey Depew

quotes.text: A man with a new idea is a crank until the idea succeeds.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard
quotes.attribution: The Roycroft Dictionary and Book of Epigrams 1923

quotes.text: When you come to a fork in the road, take it.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: You can observe a lot just by watching.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: Baseball is ninety percent mental and the other half is physical.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: If the world were perfect, it wouldn't be.
quotes.author: Yogi Berra

quotes.text: A bad workman blames his tools.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Don't bite the hand that feeds you.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: You can't have your cake and eat it too.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Early to bed and early to rise, makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: You can't make an omlette without breaking a few eggs.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Don't put all your eggs in one basket.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: With friends like these, who needs enemies?
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: When the going gets tough, the tough get going.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Never look a gift horse in the mouth.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: You can lead a horse to water but you can't make it drink.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: People who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones.

quotes.text: Keep your friends close but your enemies closer.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: If you can't take the heat, get out of the kitchen
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: He who laughs last, laughs best.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: The way to a man's heart is through his stomach.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: It's no use crying over spilt milk.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Put your money where your mouth is.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Don't make a mountain out of a molehill.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: If you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Look after the pennies and the pounds will look after themselves.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Hope for the best, but prepare for the worst.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Revenge is a dish best served cold.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Sticks and stones may break my bones but words will never hurt me.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: One swallow does not make a summer.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: The pen is mightier than the sword.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Live by the sword, die by the sword.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Time and tide wait for no man.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: The truth shall set you free.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Empty vessels make the most noise.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Where there is a will, there is a way.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Slow and steady wins the race.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Many a true word is spoken in jest.
quotes.author: Traditional English

quotes.text: Youth is wasted on the young.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.text: The female of the species is more deadly than the male.
quotes.author: Rudyard Kipling
quotes.attribution: The Female of the Species poem 1911

quotes.text: If you can keep your head when all about you are losing theirs.
quotes.author: Rudyard Kipling

quotes.text: It was the best of times it was the worst of times.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: We forge the chains we wear in life.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.text: Ask not what your country can do for you ask what you can do for your country.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.text: The ballot is stronger than the bullet.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.text: Wherever law ends tyranny begins.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.text: The past is a foreign country; they do things differently there.
quotes.author: Marcel Proust
quotes.attribution: In Search of Lost Time 1913 often misquoted

quotes.text: An army marches on its stomach.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.text: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.text: Religion is the opium of the people.
quotes.author: Karl Marx
quotes.attribution: Critique of Hegel's Philosophy of Right 1843

quotes.text: Workers of the world unite; you have nothing to lose but your chains.
quotes.author: Karl Marx

quotes.text: Prevention is better than cure.
quotes.author: Desiderius Erasmus

quotes.text: I think therefore I am.
quotes.author: Rene Descartes

quotes.text: The ends justify the means.
quotes.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quotes.text: When a man is tired of London he is tired of life.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.text: All power tends to corrupt and absolute power corrupts absolutely.
quotes.author: Lord Acton

quotes.text: I came I saw I conquered.
quotes.author: Julius Caesar
quotes.attribution: Letter to Roman Senate 47 BCE Veni vidi vici

quotes.text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.text: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: In this world nothing can be said to be certain except death and taxes.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: A penny saved is a penny earned.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Fish and visitors stink after three days.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Brevity is the soul of wit.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: The course of true love never did run smooth.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: This above all: to thine own self be true.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: The life of man is threescore years and ten.
quotes.author: Geoffrey Chaucer
quotes.attribution: The Canterbury Tales 1400 modernized from Prologue

quotes.text: All hope abandon ye who enter here.
quotes.author: John Milton
quotes.attribution: Paradise Lost 1667 via Dante but Milton's spin

quotes.text: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
quotes.author: Alexander Pope

quotes.text: Hope springs eternal in the human breast.
quotes.author: Alexander Pope

quotes.text: Do not go gentle into that good night.
quotes.author: Dylan Thomas
quotes.attribution: Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night 1951

quotes.text: Rage rage against the dying of the light.
quotes.author: Dylan Thomas
quotes.attribution: Do Not Go Gentle Into That Good Night 1951

quotes.text: It's better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
quotes.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quotes.text: Absence makes the heart grow fonder.

quotes.attribution: The Spanish Friar 1681 attrib. via paraphrase

quotes.text: Drink to me only with thine eyes.
quotes.author: Ben Jonson

quotes.text: My love is like a red red rose.
quotes.author: Robert Burns

quotes.text: I am dying as I have lived : beyond my means.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: The road to hell is paved with good intentions.
quotes.author: Saint Bernard of Clairvaux

quotes.text: Honesty is the best policy.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: Actions speak louder than words.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: A stitch in time saves nine.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.text: Fortune favors the bold.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: Discretion is the better part of valor.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: Knowledge is power.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.text: Patience is a virtue.
quotes.author: William Langland

quotes.text: Necessity is the mother of invention.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: Every cloud has a silver lining.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.text: The squeaky wheel gets the grease.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: A leopard can't change its spots.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: Absence sharpens love.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: Cold hands, warm heart.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: A full belly makes a dull brain.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: The cobbler's children go barefoot.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: A drowning man will clutch at straws.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: Fair words butter no parsnips.
quotes.author: John Clarke

quotes.text: A good name is better than riches.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: Hunger is the best sauce.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: A little learning is a dangerous thing.
quotes.author: Alexander Pope

quotes.text: No rose without a thorn.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: One man's meat is another man's poison.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: If I have seen further, it is by standing on the shoulders of Giants.
quotes.author: Isaac Newton

quotes.text: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.text: We are all in the gutter,  but some of us are looking at the stars.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: One half of the world cannot understand the pleasures of the other.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.text: Everything in moderation, including moderation.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: I don't care what is written about me so long as it isn't true.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.text: We few, we happy few, we band of brothers.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: I ain't afraid to love a man. I ain't afraid to shoot him either.
quotes.author: Annie Oakley

quotes.text: It's not the men in your life that matters, it's the life in your men.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.text: Love all,  trust a few, do wrong to none.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: The difference between fiction and reality? Fiction has to make sense.
quotes.author: Tom Clancy

quotes.text: I have spread my dreams under your feet. Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
quotes.author: W.B. Yeats
quotes.attribution: from "He Wishes for the Cloths of Heaven"

quotes.text: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.text: Democracy is the worst form of government,  except for all the others.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.text: I've been on a calendar,  but I've never been on time.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.text: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Nothing in life is to be feared; it is only to be understood.
quotes.author: Marie Curie

quotes.text: Be less curious about people and more curious about ideas.
quotes.author: Marie Curie

quotes.text: The tongue cuts deeper than the sword.
quotes.author: Traditional

quotes.text: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.
quotes.author: Joseph Stalin

quotes.text: Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: There is nothing new under the sun.
quotes.author: Ecclesiastes

quotes.text: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.text: The gods help those who help themselves.
quotes.author: Aesop

quotes.text: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: The race is not to the swift, nor the battle to the strong.
quotes.author: Bible

quotes.text: My heart beats as a king's would.
quotes.author: Elizabeth I

quotes.text: Fear makes men obedient.
quotes.author: Ivan the Terrible

quotes.text: What you do not wish done to you do not do to others.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: To know what you know and what you do not know that is true knowledge.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: You only lose what you cling to.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.text: Do not fear an enemy who attacks you; fear a friend who flatters you.
quotes.author: Miyamoto Musashi

quotes.text: The ultimate aim of martial arts is not having to use them.
quotes.author: Miyamoto Musashi

quotes.text: A single spark can start a prairie fire.
quotes.author: Mao Zedong

quotes.text: He has no enemies but is intensely disliked by his friends.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: His ignorance covers the world like a blanket and there's nothing under it.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.text: Politics is the art of the possible.
quotes.author: Otto von Bismarck

quotes.text: The balance of power is the only guarantee of peace.
quotes.author: Robert Stewart Viscount Castlereagh

quotes.text: Every man's house is his castle.
quotes.author: Robert Walpole

quotes.text: Knowledge is safer in the hands of the multitude than in the hands of the few.
quotes.author: Bede
quotes.attribution: Ecclesiastical History of the English People 731

quotes.text: Men's characters are not shaped by their circumstances but revealed by them.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.text: The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.text: In peace sons bury their fathers; in war fathers bury their sons.
quotes.author: Herodotus

quotes.text: The more corrupt the state the more numerous the laws.
quotes.author: Tacitus

quotes.text: The secret of happiness is freedom and the secret of freedom is courage.
quotes.author: Thucydides
quotes.attribution: History of the Peloponnesian War 410 BCE

quotes.text: Truth is the daughter of time.
quotes.author: Pliny the Elder

quotes.text: The only certainty is that nothing is certain.
quotes.author: Pliny the Elder

quotes.text: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.text: I am not ashamed to confess that I am ignorant of what I do not know.
quotes.author: Cicero
quotes.attribution: On the Nature of the Gods 45 BCE

quotes.text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
quotes.author: Cato the Younger

quotes.text: I would rather be right than be president.
quotes.author: Claudius
quotes.attribution: Suetonius' Lives of the Caesars 121 CE attrib. via historians

quotes.text: Every man is the architect of his own fortune.
quotes.author: Claudius

quotes.text: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Well done is better than well said.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Early to bed and early to rise makes a man healthy wealthy and wise.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: He that lies down with dogs shall rise up with fleas.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Lost time is never found again.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Many have been ruined by buying good pennyworths.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: He that can have patience can have what he will.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: We are all born ignorant but one must work hard to remain stupid.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.text: All the world's a stage and all the men and women merely players.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: The fault dear Brutus is not in our stars but in ourselves.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Cowards die many times before their deaths.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Some are born great some achieve greatness and some have greatness thrust upon them.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: What's done is done.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: There is nothing either good or bad but thinking makes it so.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.text: The raven said Nevermore.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.text: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.text: Because I could not stop for Death he kindly stopped for me.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.text: Success is counted sweetest by those who ne'er succeed.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.text: The heart asks pleasure first.
quotes.author: Emily Dickinson

quotes.text: They couldn't hit an elephant at this dist-.
quotes.author: John Sedgwick, US Civil War general

quotes.text: I should never have switched from Scotch to martinis.
quotes.author: Humphrey Bogart

quotes.text: Don't let it end like this. Tell them I said something.
quotes.author: Pancho Villa

quotes.text: I have just had eighteen whiskeys in a row. I do believe that is a record.
quotes.author: Douglas Fairbanks Sr.

quotes.text: I knew it. I knew it. Born in a hotel room, and God damn it, died in a hotel room.
quotes.author: Eugene O'Neill

quotes.text: The public have an insatiable curiosity to know everything, except what is worth knowing.
quotes.author: Oliver Herford
quotes.attribution: The Rubaiyat of a Persian Kitten 1904

quotes.text: A bore is a man who, when you ask him how he is, tells you.
quotes.author: Bert Leston Taylor

quotes.text: Some people think they have an open mind, when it is really their mouth.
quotes.author: Arnold H. Glasow

quotes.text: Many a man's reputation would not know his character if they met on the street.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.text: The world is full of willing people; some willing to work, the rest willing to let them.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.text: An optimist is a man who starts a crossword puzzle with a fountain pen.
quotes.author: Don Marquis

quotes.text: The trouble with most of us is that we would rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.
quotes.author: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.text: Many a man who thinks he's thinking is only rearranging his prejudices.
quotes.author: William James
